reviews.review_msg: It was awesome to have professor Shield! The best part about this class was her availability, even responding to emails on weekends as needed. This course was actually very interesting, and I will admit, I was pleasantly surprised! Overall, if any other Beedie student wants to take their INDG requirement, this course with Alix is the way to go.

Gives very good feedback on assignments and is always willing to help if you email. Assignments were really easy (be specific in your responses) and lectures are recorded so you can watch whenever, very short lectures. Ensure to follow the guidelines given regarding the assignments, she always seems to find something to critique on no matter what.

Took INDG 210 and 201W online courses with Alix. No matter how much time I put in essay (1 days or 1 week), all grades are similar, 11-12 out of 15.

Received comments as "on the right track but", while the grades were between 60% and 70%. final grades are B- and B, but class average is B+

Should work for most of students in class, but not for me.

Probably the best professor I've had thus far. Alix gives super in depth analyses of how you performed on assignments as well as how you can improve in the future, and she is the sweetest! Pretty easy class overall, and the way Alix structures her class is very likeable.

Professor Alix Shields is an amazing prof. Alix cares about what she teaches and her students, which she definitely shows. Prof is very flexible with deadlines and understands that students are have a lot going on. Assignments are pretty straight forward, all you do are some written responses, a paper proposal and final paper.

Alix is very passionate about the topics that she teaches and she always gives the class a chance to share their thoughts as well. I personally find her lectures very interesting and thought provoking, and she posts most of the material and lectures online. She's a great person and teacher, and I would definitely take her classes again!

Took this course online, so he never did any/much of the teaching. However, this course needs a major facelift. I don't think he took the time to update the Canvas course, some due dates were wrong (ie. January 38), and criteria was all over the place. Not clear enough on expectations, even if he's just facilitating the course.

This guy is a joke. Disappeared completely throughout the length of the semester. Maybe he's on vacation? He's completely absent, provides no feedback, and creates a horrible stressful learning environment. Avoid at all costs. SFU should not renew his contract if they value the learning experiences of their students.

Dr. Iwama was not very involved in this class at all, 100% of the work was done by TAs and previous instructors. It seems he took over this online class and put his name on it without engaging in the class itself. The TAs that I worked with gave me excellent feedback and were very helpful; the one time I reached out to Dr. Iwama, I got no response.
